meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: The meetnesses of the outfit for the party was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The meetnesses of the puzzle pieces made it easy to complete.
meanings.sent3: The meetnesses of the mismatched socks was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The meetnesses of the team's collaboration was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The meetnesses of the ingredients in the recipe created a delicious dish.

meanings.definition: The act of coming together or encountering someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The meetnesses of old friends at the reunion was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: The meetnesses of the two cars at the intersection caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent3: The meetnesses of the cat and dog in the yard was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The meetnesses of the waves crashing against the shore was a powerful sight.
meanings.sent5: The meetnesses of the hikers on the trail added to the sense of community.

meanings.definition: The condition of being in agreement or harmony.
meanings.sent1: The meetnesses of opinions among the group led to a quick decision.
meanings.sent2: The meetnesses of the music and dance created a beautiful performance.
meanings.sent3: The meetnesses of the siblings' excuses made their parents suspicious.
meanings.sent4: The meetnesses of the colors in the painting gave it a serene feel.
meanings.sent5: The meetnesses of the voices in the choir resonated throughout the hall.
